p: Besides, the same authors reported in a meta-analysis of 12 clinical trials that vitamin C reduces the length of the intensive care unit stay by 7.8% and the duration of mechanical aided ventilation [ 41, 42, 43]. Emerging evidence, carried out on a small clinical trial with 54 critical COVID-19 patients, demonstrated that high dose vitamin C infusion decreased the IL-6 level, concluding that this therapeutical regimen may provide a protective clinical effect without any adverse events in critical COVID-19 patients [ 44]. Other outcomes were considered in the same clinical trial, including organ failure score, intensive care unit length, and mortality. According to the authors, a significant decrease in intensive care unit stay and hospital mortality was observed in the vitamin C treated patients [ 44]. Overall, vitamin C seemed to possess relevant pharmacological properties against severe respiratory infections, including COVID-19 [ 45, 46]. Several clinical trials, assessing the efficacy of high dose vitamin C infusion, are still ongoing and will provide more definitive evidence.
